title: Alisson won't be available until mid-October, says Jurgen Klopp
text: Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson Becker will not return to first-team action until at least mid-October, Jurgen Klopp has confirmed in his pre-match press conference ahead of this weekend’s game against Newcastle. The £60 million man has been sidelined since he picked up a calf injury during the Premier League opener against Norwich, and there had been speculation that he could return to the starting XI within the next few weeks. Klopp, however, played down the likelihood of Alisson making a comeback any time soon. We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. They play Manchester United at Old Trafford on 20 October. Klopp also gave a more positive update on fellow injury casualty Naby Keita, who injured his hip prior to the Uefa Super Cup final against Chelsea. “Naby is close, much closer than Ali. I think he could be in training when we come back from Napoli next week.” Liverpool provisional squad: Adrian, Alexander-Arnold, Matip, Van Dijk, Robertson, Henderson, Milner, Fabinho, Salah, Firmino, Mane, Kelleher, Gomez, Oxlade-Chamberlain, Lallana, Wijnaldum, Shaqiri, Origi.
